snippet: The F.C.C.’s approach to net neutrality is dead, and that’s a good thing.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Susan Crawford contends court ruling in the case of Verizon verses Federal Communications Commission offers an opportunity for the commission to reverse industry-compromised decisions that have long undermined its authority over telecom services; urges the commission to relabel high-speed Internet access a common carriage service and treat it as basic infrastructure.
lead_paragraph: The F.C.C.’s approach to net neutrality is dead, and that’s a good thing.

headline.main: Back to the Digital Drawing Board
headline.print_headline: Back to the Digital Drawing Board
